reviewText: Angus MacGyver RIPHow else can you say good bye to an friend. I know Richard Dean Anderson has done the MacGyver Mastercard ads..but it isn't the sameIn this final season of my hero, we close the book on Murdoc, The Phoenix Foundation, Pete, Jack Dalton and the bounty hunting family the Coltons. I wish they made more than 14 final episodes, but you take what you are givenThe sadest part of this set is the two Mac Gyver TV movies are not part of this collection. Nor does Anderson do any  episode audio commentary..so it is sad day for DUCT TAPE, Paper Clips and MacGyver fansI will get this final DVD set, however It will be bittersweet for meBennet Pomerantz AUDIOWORLD

reviewText: This is the last season, and it's only 14 episodes long, but I guess I expected them to to at least try. He's living in a different neighborhood now, and there is an entirely different cast of characters. Pete doesn't show up much, and when he does he's wearing dark glasses and carrying a cane for the blind.It was somewhat interesting...I think I just missed Penny and some of the others. The episodes also became very forumlaic. They did do one last episode with Murdoc, so that was good.  They also did an episode with the Colton brothers, and it JUST the Colton brothers, with only MacGyver appearing at the beginning and at the end. I thought I paid for 14 MacGyver episodes, NOT 13 MacGyver episodes and 1 Colton brothers episode.  It was very annoying. I didn't really watch it.Overall, I'd have to say this was my least favorite of all the seasons, by far.  If you're not a diehard fan, don't buy it.  If you are, well then you're going to have to have it to see what happens in the last episode!
summary: Not everything I was hoping for...

reviewText: Paramount has to be the cheapest company out there, they'll do anything to get the stuff out there with putting as little effort as there is into it. This Final season was cut short, so they should include those 2 TV Movies on it, but do they? no!Get with it guys! I mean, you don't remaster any of the episodes, and you don't remaster the sound, it's 2.0 Mono, whereas you could remaster the picture and give it an upgrade to 5.1 Dolby, but you don't. You just wanna get it out there, and if it sells, then I bet you would jump on the bandwagon and remaster it. And force us fans to fork out more money. How cheap can you be! Maybe in your eyes, it's good business, but to me it's ripping people off!Why not release it the right way the first time? that way you won't have to spend money down the road, and re-release it.just my opinion.I am however glad that Season 7 is finally coming out!I am still watching Season 4, just finished Disc 1, and still have Season 5 to get to, and I'm getting Season 6 this Friday. So Season 7 will top off my collection. Maybe one day though we'll get better quality versions of these shows released. Until that day though we'll have to live with these BARE BONES versions as someone called it.

reviewerName: MacGyver "With God, ALL things are possible!"
reviewText: I can't wait to get MacGyver Season 7 on DVD and complete my MacGyver collection!!! :-)  I love MacGyver! It's by far my favorite show.  I was hoping the two TV-movies ("MacGyver: Lost Treasure of Atlantis" and "MacGyver: Trail to Doomsday") would be on there, but if not then hopefully they'll be released separately (with tons of extras included!)  There are some great episodes in Season 7, as there are in every season.  Some monumental ones for me include "Obsessed" (the last appearance of Murdoc), "Good Knight, MacGyver" (Part 1 and 2) (in which we learn MacGyver's first name), "The Coltons" (the spin-off attempt for The Colton bounty-hunting family), and especially "The Stringer" (series finale- we meet Sam and see MacGyver retire from the Phoenix Foundation in a tearful goodbye with Pete)- and "The Mountain of Youth" (one last fun adventure with Jack Dalton!)And to answer an earlier question, MacGyver's series finale episode is indeed "The Stringer".  It was shown on April 25, 1992 and did so well that it was later decided to air the "lost" episode, filmed previously but apparently shelved for the moment in favor of other episodes- "The Mountain of Youth"- which aired on May 21, 1992.

reviewText: After all these years I am still a devoted MacGyver fan, and I enjoyed watching all 7 seasons of MacGyver. I was sad that there were fewer episodes in this final season, but was very glad to buy them to complete my set! :-) My only regret is that they didn't include the 2 made for tv movies (Atlantis, and Trail To Doomsday)in the 7th season. I hope Paramount puts those out soon! That would officially complete my set of MacGyver episodes. ;-) I would highly recommend all the MacGyver episodes including the 7th season to anyone who is a MacGyver fan or anyone who has seen MacGyver on TV Land or any other tv stations. Unfortunately Macgyver has been taken off of TV Land, but all of us fans are hoping that another network will pick him up and start showing his episodes. Anyway, I'm glad I have the 7th season. These episodes are really good! :-)

reviewText: The Final season of MacGyver was shortened to 14 episodes as well as the 2 movies that followed in 1994. But since the season was so short at least they had some great episodes in this season.Episode list.1.) Honest Abe 9/16/1991Mac's trip to the airport to pick a friend's father arriving for his grandson's bar mitzvah turns into a wild international caper involving Caribbean terrorists and a stolen helicopter.2.) The 'Hood 9/23/1991MacGyver moves into a new part of town after his houseboat was destroyed in a fire. Mac helps rescue one of his new neighbors after she overhears two hit-men planning a job.3.) Obsessed 9/30/1991The ghost of his archenemy Murdoc leaves MacGyver sleepless and on edge just as he is about to supervise the security of the criminal trial of a deposed dictator, a task that could determine Pete's continued employment at The Phoenix Foundation.4.) The Promethus Syndrome 10/7/1991MacGyver becomes personally involved in the effort to find a psychopathic arsonist who killed one of his friends.5.) The Coltons 10/14/1991Mac's old friends, the bounty-hunting Colton brothers try to find a young woman who's the only witness to a Chinatown murder, aided by their wise and patient mother, their impatient younger brother and their dog, Frog.6.) The Walking Dead 10/21/1991Mac helps his neighbor, Mama Lorraine, rescue a young student activist who has been kidnapped and turned into a zombie by Haitian terrorists hiding behind a powerful voodoo priest.7.) Good Knight MacGyver (Part 1 of 2) 11/4/1991A genealogy investigation and a knock on the head takes Mac back to King Arthur's court, where he must use his knowledge to prove Merlin innocent of harming the King, find the fair Cecilia and foil Morgana's attempt to take over the throne.8.) Good Knight MacGyver (Part 2 of 2) 11/11/1991This episode continues the previous when a genealogy investigation and a knock on the head takes Mac back to King Arthur's court, where he must use his knowledge to prove Merlin innocent of harming the King, find the fair Cecilia and foil Morgana's attempt to take over the throne.9.) Deadly Silents 11/18/1991Mac tries to help an old silent film star retrieve the only existing prints of his work from a pair of special-effects obsessed fans, who try to catch MacGyver in a deadly trap.10.) Split Decision 12/2/1991Mac's friend Earl Dent looks to him for help when he fights to retain custody of his teenage daughter while preparing for a boxing comeback that bookmakers want him to throw.11.) Gunz 'n Boyz 12/16/1991Mac and the Challenger Club try to help a boy prepared to take the rap for another boy murdered by weapons dealers exploiting the fear and suspicion in the neighborhood.12.) Off The Wall 12/30/1991Mac battles a callous slumlord when a young graffiti artist asks for help when his grandmother faces eviction from the apartment where she's spent her life.13.) The Stringer 4/25/1992While taking on the cause of a Chinese dissident on the run, MacGyver is helped by a young photo journalist named Sam. But Macgyver is in for the shock of his life when Sam tells him what his name stands for. It's "Sean Angus Macgyver".....14.) The Mountain of Youth 5/21/1992Mac and Jack search for a mythical fountain of youth in a land of paradise and find a tribe of people who live over 150 years old. They discover the tribe could be at risk, since the government has a secret heavy water facility used for nuclear weapon technology.That completes the MacGyver series although the 2 movies which aired in 1994 are unknown if they will be included but I'd like to see it as well. Enjoy!
summary: Final season reveals how MacGyver can get through the cracks.

reviewText: Although I purchased seasons 2 - 7 of the MacGyver Series from Amazon as separate purchases for economic reasons (and to be sure I was really going to view them all), I'm electing to let this review cover the entire lot.  I started buying these DVD's from Amazon because, having purchased Season 1 in a store, I was unable to find any of the others.  I am glad and grateful that indeed Amazon was able to direct me to them at a price I could afford.My personal opinion is that MacGyver is one of the best shows that ever appeared on TV.  My mother and I both enjoyed them tremendously, so much so that we named our Dalmatian dog after the character.  The name proved fortuitous, because like the TV hero, the dog survived a fall which really should have killed him!  In any event, viewing these videos again has been a poignant and nostalgic experience, but a very delightful one.  I have been so blessed by this series of DVD's that I am sharing them with my 13-year-old grandson, and hope that he enjoys them as much as his grandmother and great-grandmother did during their original television presentation.
